section.title: What's Included?
section.para:
This binary release includes:
cassandra: Contains the script for creating the Cassandra Keyspace.
docs: Contains all relevant documentation in respective subfolders.
jboss-5.1.0.GA: The core server with two profiles "default" and "simulator". The "default" profile is a clean profile where you will have to start from scratch and configure the entire SS7 Stack and SMSC Gateway. The "simulator" profile is a pre-configured profile to work with jss7-simulator. Refer to the Admin Guide for instructions on how to start the server in either of the profiles.
resources: Contains SLEE MAP RA jars.
tools: Contains SLEE tools and jss7-simulator.

formalpara.title: Support for datagramm and transactional modes
formalpara.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; now comes with support for SMPP datagramm and transactional modes. Previous versions supported only ForwardAndStore mode.

formalpara.title: Forward and store mode
formalpara.para: A special "Forward and store" mode has been introduced for the purpose of process optimization. A user can configure the SMSC Gateway to have messages stored in the cassandra database only if an attempt to deliver fails the first time. This mode also enables delivering messages in the shortest time in the first attempt.

formalpara.title: GSM8 message encoding support
formalpara.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; now comes with support for GSM8 encoding (Now all GSM7, GSM8 and UCS2 are supported).

formalpara.title: Latest version of TelScale JSS7 library and Datastax driver
formalpara.para: The latest TelScale JSS7 6.2.0 library and Datastax version are included in this release.

formalpara.title: Processing statistics
formalpara.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; introduces statistic counters for some key parameters. For example, number of messages received / sent. These statistics can now be observed in the GUI.

formalpara.title: X-headers for SIP message
formalpara.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; can now process special X-headers for SIP messages that help in sending UDH to/from SIP etc.

formalpara.title: SMSC Pause Option
formalpara.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; comes with a SMSC Pause Option. A user can pause message delivery (incoming storeAndForward messages will be stored in a database; incoming datagramm, transactional and forwardAndStore messages will be rejected).

formalpara.title: Message content stored in text format
formalpara.para: Message content is now stored in text format in the database field "MESSAGE_TEXT" (UDH is kept in binary form in a separate database field).

formalpara.title: Command Line SMPP Load Testing Tool
formalpara.para: A new Command line load testing tool is now available for generating SMPP traffic, just like HLR simulator.

formalpara.title: Process throttling SMPP responses
formalpara.para: In datagramm, transactional and FAS modes the SMSC will send throttling SMPP responses when throttling problems occur. The smpp-load Client will now appropriately process them and resend requests to SMSC.

formalpara.title: Null Password for ESME definition
formalpara.para: While defining ESME, Password can be null.

formalpara.title: Additional configuration
formalpara.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; &THIS.VERSION; has additional configuration options. For example, storing records into CDR's and archive database tables, rejecting all incoming SS7 originated messages, etc.

section.title: Configuration Settings
section.para: You must perform post-installation configuration of the Gateway according to instructions in the &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; Admin Guide. Before using in Production, you must remember to fine-tune Memory, Database and logging settings for better performance.

warning.para: Failure to configure memory, database, logging and other settings as per the instructions in the Admin Guide may result in poor performance of the Gateway.

section.title: Documentation
section.para: When you download the binary release and extract the contents of the zip file, you will notice that the top level directory is named telscale-smsc-<version> and within the telscale-smsc-<version>/docs folder you will find the &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; Installation Guide and Admin Guide. For installation and usage guidance, please refer to these guides that will help you to install and configure the Gateway.

section.title: Support
section.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; &THIS.APPLICATION; is fully supported by TeleStax. For help with the software or to raise bugs please login to your account at and follow the instructions.
